page.title: 08SANDHURST VILLAGE SERVICES
page.content: THE PROBLEM OF A RURAL COMMUNITY Sandhurst has very few services as it is too small to support any but the most basic functions. There is one small sub-post office cum store (see page 5) but it is hardly economically viable although it serves an important need for the elderly. The village pub, The White Horse Inn, has closed. Falling numbers mean that the Primary School will soon close, the Youth Club has already gone. Sandhurst is on mains drainage but has no street lights. There is only one bus per week, to Gloucester on a Friday. One of the villagers, Mrs Goode, deliv- ers the local Â£Citizen' newspaper every evening and acts as a messenger between the elderly in particular. At Woolridge The Rising Sun is a busy public house with a skittle alley and is a focal point for the local people.
